Class TenantLimitsHelper

java.lang.Object
grafiosch.repository.TenantLimitsHelper
public abstract class TenantLimitsHelper extends Object
Utility class for managing and checking tenant-specific entity limits.

  • Field Details

    • GLOBAL_LIMIT_KEY_TO_ENTITY_MAP

      public static final Map<String,Class<?>> GLOBAL_LIMIT_KEY_TO_ENTITY_MAP
      Maps global parameter keys to their corresponding entity classes.

      Parameter keys follow the pattern "gt.limit.day.{EntityClassName}" where:

      • "gt." is the global prefix (BaseConstants.GT_PREFIX)
      • "limit.day." indicates daily entity creation limits
      • "{EntityClassName}" is the simple name of the entity class (e.g., "MailSendRecv", "MailSettingForward", "UDFMetadataGeneral")

      Examples:

      • "gt.limit.day.MailSendRecv" - limits daily mail send/receive operations

  • Constructor Details

    • TenantLimitsHelper

      public TenantLimitsHelper()

  • Method Details

    • canAddWhenCheckedAgainstMayBeExistingTenantLimit

      public static <T extends BaseID<Integer>> boolean canAddWhenCheckedAgainstMayBeExistingTenantLimit(jakarta.persistence.EntityManager entityManager, T entityClass)
      Checks whether a new entity can be added based on existing tenant limits.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the entity type extending BaseID with Integer primary key
      Parameters:
      entityManager - the JPA EntityManager for database operations
      entityClass - the entity instance to check limits for
      Returns:
      true if the entity can be added without exceeding limits

    • getMaxTenantLimitsByKey

      public static TenantLimit getMaxTenantLimitsByKey(jakarta.persistence.EntityManager entityManager, String key)
      Retrieves tenant limit information for a specific limit key.
      Parameters:
      entityManager - the JPA EntityManager for database operations
      key - the global parameter key identifying the limit (e.g., "gt.limit.day.MailSendRecv", "gt.limit.day.MailSettingForward")
      Returns:
      a TenantLimit object containing limit and usage information

    • getMaxTenantLimitsByMsgKeys

      public static List<TenantLimit> getMaxTenantLimitsByMsgKeys(jakarta.persistence.EntityManager entityManager, List<String> msgKeys)
      Retrieves tenant limit information using message keys instead of direct parameter keys.

      Message keys are converted to parameter keys by:

      1. Adding the correct prefix (as present in GLOBAL_LIMIT_KEY_TO_ENTITY_MAP)
      2. Converting to lowercase
      3. Replacing underscores with dots

      The required prefix is determined dynamically by checking which key exists in the map.

      Example: "LIMIT_DAY_MAILSENDRECV" becomes "g.limit.day.mailsendrecv"

      Parameters:
      entityManager - the JPA EntityManager for database operations
      msgKeys - list of message keys to retrieve limits for (format: "LIMIT_DAY_{ENTITYNAME}")
      Returns:
      a list of TenantLimit objects with message keys preserved in the response

    • getMaxValueByKey

      public static int getMaxValueByKey(jakarta.persistence.EntityManager entityManager, String key)
      Retrieves the maximum allowed value for a specific limit key.
      Parameters:
      entityManager - the JPA EntityManager for database operations
      key - the global parameter key to retrieve the maximum value for (format: "gt.limit.day.{EntityClassName}")
      Returns:
      the maximum allowed value for the limit
